snippet: Following the trail of white storks through northeast Poland, where almost three-quarters of them live, offers an opportunity to explore the area’s history, wildlife and landscapes.
abstract: Zywkowo, Poland, village on Russian border with only 25 residents, eagerly welcomes eco-tourism trade, with travelers coming from all over world to view annual migration of nesting white storks; massive nests of beloved birds dot village's chimneys, rooftops and custom-made platforms; suggestions for best stork-viewing itinerary highlighted, including stay in Poland's Bialowieza National Park.
lead_paragraph: Following the trail of white storks through northeast Poland, where almost three-quarters of them live, offers an opportunity to explore the area’s history, wildlife and landscapes.

headline.print_headline: For Beloved White Storks, a Nesting Refuge
headline.main: An Unlikely Tourist Attraction in Poland: Storks
